items.title: Trump rethinks immigration leadership after Pretti's death
items.standfirst: Border Patrol commander Gregory Bovino is expected to leave Minneapolis after backlash over the fatal shooting of ICU nurse Alex Pretti. President Trump places border czar Tom Homan in direct control of the operation, signaling a shift to rein in the most controversial enforcement tactics. Here's FRANCE 24's Kethevane Gorjestani analysis of the move.
items.content: Border Patrol commander Gregory Bovino is expected to leave Minneapolis after backlash over the fatal shooting of ICU nurse Alex Pretti. President Trump places border czar Tom Homan in direct control of the operation, signaling a shift to rein in the most controversial enforcement tactics. Here's FRANCE 24's Kethevane Gorjestani analysis of the move.

items.title: Outrage in Minnesota as Trump signals ICE pullback
items.standfirst: Protests continue across Minneapolis after ICU nurse Alex Pretti is shot and killed by federal immigration agents, sparking outrage, student walkouts, and demonstrations against ICE. As tensions grow, President Donald Trump speaks with Minnesota Governor Tim Walz and Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey, while some federal agents‚Äîincluding a senior border patrol commander‚Äîare set to leave the city as early as Tuesday.
items.content: Protests continue across Minneapolis after ICU nurse Alex Pretti is shot and killed by federal immigration agents, sparking outrage, student walkouts, and demonstrations against ICE. As tensions grow, President Donald Trump speaks with Minnesota Governor Tim Walz and Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey, while some federal agents‚Äîincluding a senior border patrol commander‚Äîare set to leave the city as early as Tuesday.

items.title: Bovino to leave Minneapolis as Trump reshuffles immigration operation
items.standfirst: Border Patrol commander Gregory Bovino ‚Äì the US official behind President Donald Trump's aggressive immigration enforcement operations ‚Äì is expected to leave Minneapolis on Tuesday after Saturday's fatal shooting of ICU nurse Alex Pretty ignited political backlash. "Some federal agents" will also leave the city, the Minneapolis mayor said.

items.title: Video evidence of Alex Pretti's killing contradicts Trump administration's account
items.standfirst: Alex Pretti, a 37-year-old ICU nurse, was shot and killed in Minneapolis on Saturday, just weeks after Ren√©e Good's fatal shooting in the same US city. The Department of Homeland Security claims Pretti was "brandishing" a gun and was a "domestic terrorist" who was aggressively approaching federal agents, but video evidence directly contradicts the Trump administration's "official" version of events. Vedika Bahl goes through multiple angles of the incident in Truth or Fake.
items.content: Alex Pretti, a 37-year-old ICU nurse, was shot and killed in Minneapolis on Saturday, just weeks after Ren√©e Good's fatal shooting in the same US city. The Department of Homeland Security claims Pretti was "brandishing" a gun and was a "domestic terrorist" who was aggressively approaching federal agents, but video evidence directly contradicts the Trump administration's "official" version of events. Vedika Bahl goes through multiple angles of the incident in Truth or Fake.

clusters.title: 'Mother of all' trade deals signed between India and EU
clusters.neutral_headline: ‚ÄòMother of all deals‚Äô: EU and India sign free trade agreement

items.title: 'Mother of all' trade deals signed between India and EU
items.standfirst: India and the European Union announced a landmark trade deal after two decades of talks, creating a market of two billion people and aiming to strengthen ties against global economic pressures from the US and China. The agreement will cut or eliminate tariffs on nearly 97% of EU exports, potentially saving up to 4 billion euros annually. Leaders hailed the pact as a major opportunity for both economies, representing a significant share of global GDP and trade.
items.content: India and the European Union announced a landmark trade deal after two decades of talks, creating a market of two billion people and aiming to strengthen ties against global economic pressures from the US and China. The agreement will cut or eliminate tariffs on nearly 97% of EU exports, potentially saving up to 4 billion euros annually. Leaders hailed the pact as a major opportunity for both economies, representing a significant share of global GDP and trade.

items.title: ‚ÄòThe mother of all trade deals‚Äô: EU and India sign landmark trade agreement ‚Äì Europe live
items.standfirst: Wide-ranging deal will cut tariffs to zero over seven years as Modi hails ‚Äòlargest free trade agreement‚Äô in India‚Äôs historyMeanwhile, there is a growing controversy around the potential presence of US Immigration and Customs Enforcement officers during the upcoming winter Olympic Games in Milan-Cortina in Italy.Agents from the controversial agency are expected to form part of the security detail accompanying US officials, as US vice-president JD Vance and state secretary Marco Rubio are scheduled to attend the games, AP and AFP reported via US diplomatic sources. Continue reading...

items.title: India-EU Trade Agreement: What We Know
items.standfirst: The European Union and India concluded a free trade agreement after nearly two decades of negotiations. The deal is expected ...
items.content: The European Union and India concluded a free trade agreement after nearly two decades of negotiations. The deal is expected ...

items.title: India and EU seal landmark trade pact after 20 years of talks
items.standfirst: India and the European Union announce the completion of a major trade agreement in New Delhi, ending two decades of negotiations. Prime Minister Narendra Modi and EU leaders describe the pact as the ‚Äúmother of all deals,‚Äù aimed at strengthening economic cooperation and reducing dependence on the United States and China. The agreement covers about 25% of global GDP and one-third of global trade, creating significant opportunities for India‚Äôs 1.4 billion people and millions across the European Union. As FRANCE 24's Navodita Kumari explains, this represent a 'real political shift' for India.
items.content: India and the European Union announce the completion of a major trade agreement in New Delhi, ending two decades of negotiations. Prime Minister Narendra Modi and EU leaders describe the pact as the ‚Äúmother of all deals,‚Äù aimed at strengthening economic cooperation and reducing dependence on the United States and China. The agreement covers about 25% of global GDP and one-third of global trade, creating significant opportunities for India‚Äôs 1.4 billion people and millions across the European Union. As FRANCE 24's Navodita Kumari explains, this represent a 'real political shift' for India.

clusters.title: At least 18 people dead as Philippines ferry with 350 onboard sinks
clusters.neutral_headline: At least 18 people dead as Philippines ferry with 350 onboard sinks

items.title: At least 18 people dead as Philippines ferry with 350 onboard sinks
items.standfirst: Rescuers save at least 316 after inter-island ferry sank en route from city of Zamboanga to southern Jolo islandA ferry with more than 350 people onboard sank early on Monday near an island in the southern Philippines, killing at least 18 people, officials said. Rescuers saved hundreds more, while a fleet of coastguard and naval ships searched for those still missing.Coastguard officials said the cargo and passenger ferry apparently encountered technical problems and sank after midnight. The steel-hulled vessel abruptly tilted to one side and took on water, hurling people into the sea in the darkness, according to a rescued passenger who lost his six-month-old baby. Continue reading...
items.content: Rescuers save at least 316 after inter-island ferry sank en route from city of Zamboanga to southern Jolo islandA ferry with more than 350 people onboard sank early on Monday near an island in the southern Philippines, killing at least 18 people, officials said. Rescuers saved hundreds more, while a fleet of coastguard and naval ships searched for those still missing.Coastguard officials said the cargo and passenger ferry apparently encountered technical problems and sank after midnight. The steel-hulled vessel abruptly tilted to one side and took on water, hurling people into the sea in the darkness, according to a rescued passenger who lost his six-month-old baby. Continue reading...

items.title: Hundreds rescued after ferry capsizes in the Philippines
items.standfirst: At least 15 people were killed and more are missing after a ferry carrying more than 300 people capsized off the coast of the Philippines. The ferry was sailing with 332 passengers and 27 crew members when it apparently encountered technical problems and sank after midnight.
items.content: At least 15 people were killed and more are missing after a ferry carrying more than 300 people capsized off the coast of the Philippines. The ferry was sailing with 332 passengers and 27 crew members when it apparently encountered technical problems and sank after midnight.

clusters.title: Uganda: Bobi Wine's wife tells him to stay in hiding after assault at their home
clusters.neutral_headline: Uganda's military chief denies army assaulted Bobi Wine's wife

items.title: Uganda: Bobi Wine's wife tells him to stay in hiding after assault at their home
items.standfirst: Muhoozi Kainerugaba, Uganda's military chief, has denied accusations that soldiers had been sent to the home of opposition leader Bobi Wine to beat his wife. Wine has been in hiding since disputing the outcome of the mid-January elections that returned President Yoweri Museveni to power for a seventh term. Kainerugaba claims that troops did not raid Wine's home and assault his wife, Barbra, because it is not worth the army's time. Barbra is currently in hospital. She recorded the intruders on her phone and says they forced their way into her home, choked her, mocked her and assaulted her staff, demanding that she tell them where her husband is.
items.content: Muhoozi Kainerugaba, Uganda's military chief, has denied accusations that soldiers had been sent to the home of opposition leader Bobi Wine to beat his wife. Wine has been in hiding since disputing the outcome of the mid-January elections that returned President Yoweri Museveni to power for a seventh term. Kainerugaba claims that troops did not raid Wine's home and assault his wife, Barbra, because it is not worth the army's time. Barbra is currently in hospital. She recorded the intruders on her phone and says they forced their way into her home, choked her, mocked her and assaulted her staff, demanding that she tell them where her husband is.

items.title: Uganda's military chief denies army assaulted Bobi Wine's wife
items.standfirst: Barbara Kyagulanyi, married to the opposition leader, says she refused to reveal her husband's whereabouts.
items.content: Barbara Kyagulanyi, married to the opposition leader, says she refused to reveal her husband's whereabouts.

items.title: Remains of last Israeli hostage found in Gaza, paving way for next phase of ceasefire
items.standfirst: The remains of the last hostage held in Gaza have been identified, the Israeli military said Monday, ending a more than two-year saga for captives' families in Israel ‚Äî and paving the way for the second phase of the ceasefire in the war-torn enclave.
